thread.title: U.S. welcomes “significant progress” in Armenia-Azerbaijan processes
thread.title_full: U.S. welcomes “significant progress” in Armenia-Azerbaijan processes

title: U.S. welcomes “significant progress” in Armenia-Azerbaijan processes
text: U.S. welcomes “significant progress” in Armenia-Azerbaijan processes January 19, 2024 - 12:37 AMT PanARMENIAN.Net - Armenia and Azerbaijan have made “significant progress” in the work towards peace over the past year, Spokesperson for the U.S. Department of State Matthew Miller told reporters on Thursday, January 19. “We welcome the work towards peace between Armenia and Azerbaijan. We support the sovereignty and territorial integrity of both countries. We hope they will sign a durable peace treaty that recognizes such sovereignty and territorial integrity, the sooner the better,” Miller said. The parties have made significant progress over the past year, and we encourage them to maintain momentum building on past negotiations and conclude an agreement. Also Thursday, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said Baku is ready to sign an agreement with Yerevan on Russian territory. Top stories The EU does not intend to conduct military exercises with Armenia, Lead Spokesperson for EU Foreign Affairs and Security Policy Peter Stano says. Hikmet Hajiyev has said that there is no place for USAID operation in Azerbaijan any longer. A telephone conversation between Putin and Pashinyan before the CSTO summit is not planned, Peskov says. London’s Armenian community has been left feeling “under attack” after the city’s Genocide monument was vandalised. Partner news Latest news
